review.reviewBody: These are not as good as Chacos for heavy duty use, but I bought them to use as camp shoes when adventure motorcycling. They are nice and lightweight and pack small.
review.name: Much lighter than Chacos

review.reviewBody: I didn't know when I ordered it that the heel strap is NOT adjustable. That makes it so I can not position my toes in the straps properly.
review.name: I would NOT purchase this product again.

review.reviewBody: The shoes are fine (after a couple weeks anyway), but the email bombardment from the company is overbearing. If I could go back, I'd buy these anonymously from a retailer even if they cost more that way.
review.name: Be cautious with personal information

review.reviewBody: I love the product and its style, but it doesn't fit true to size. This is now my third pair and the sizing isn't correct. I may be sizing my feet wrong, or the sizing needs to be a little smaller when selecting TEVAs.
review.name: Sizing is always an issue..

review.reviewBody: Fast shipment, true to size, very nice quality, clean easily.
review.name: All time FAV

review.reviewBody: Teva, in my opinion should discontinue this product from its line of sandals. It doesn't reflect the high quality of the brand. I did return them and bought the Teva f1 5 universal. It's perfect and what I expect from the Teva line of products.
review.name: I would not buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my 20 year old pair that finally let go in the sole. I know-20 years is amazing for seasonal footwear! These new Tevas feel familiar and pretty comfortable. They are super adjustable and easy to put on. However, I would love to change out the foot pad from a raised surface to the smooth surface that I'm used to.
review.name: Good Product-Would Love One Small Design Change

review.reviewBody: I decided to give these a try and I love them! Super comfortable and love the designs. Some have lamented the lack of back strap adjustment. I like it, less to adjust.
review.name: I would but this product again and have.

review.reviewBody: Had to order a pair of Tevas because my feet were swollen with edema. That's the only shoe I can wear right now. Thank heavens for the Tevas.
review.name: Love my Tevas

review.reviewBody: Been wearing cheaply made sandals and flip flops for years. Recently on a kayak trip on the Cheat River when my sandals blew up, I decided to give Tevas a try. Now I am kicking myself for now putting on a pair 30 years ago. Totally comfortable, no slip no slide just the perfect sandal.
review.name: Why wasn't I wearing these earlier.

description: Buy the Hydrapak SoftFlask 250ml Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SoftFlask 250ml Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak SoftFlask 250ml Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These little soft flasks are great! Used them for a 50k recently to hold pickle juice and mashed potatoes. The 150 ml and 250 ml flask caps have different valves included with them, I am glad I bought a 2 pack of each size so I can interchange the caps for different sized flasks as needed. One has a open hole about 10mm ish wide that is perfect for eating real food, potatoes, applesauce, gel, etc. The other has a squeeze valve cap similar to a bike bottle that is more appropriate for liquids. I cant remember which came with which size though. It would be helpful if @hydrapak included photos of the valves as that was a sort of surprise to me when they arrived. But, I love them!! They are perfect!
review.name: NUTRITION!!! Made simple with Hydrapak.

review.reviewBody: The Feed sells branded versions of this same flask in the 150ml size, but the 250ml size is clutch if you need a lot of gel for a long run or ultra race. I fill these with liquidy gels like SIS and bring one or two along for long runs, the rest go in drop bags for races. Avoids the hassle of having to rip open gels and stash the sticky trash. Pop top works great and keeps everything clean. So convenient and reusable. Love it!
review.name: This is what you need for gels on long runs

review.reviewBody: The bottle smells like plastic, which makes me concerned that I am ingesting harmful chemicals when I drink from it.
review.name: Smells like plastic
comment:
Hello, 

We are sorry you are experiencing a bad taste with your product. As a leading provider of performance hydration, any issue with our product is taken seriously. Our products are made from a food-grade Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU) material. It is the industry standard because of its food-safe properties and its durability.

TPU is safe, reliable and non toxic. It’s 100% BPA and PVC free: every one of our products meets or exceeds the most rigorous national food safety standards in the world. Unfortunately, a small percentage of users can experience an unpleasant taste, which varies from person to person. Please try to following to reduce the taste issue:

1) Fill the container up with water and add a few drops of lemon juice (about 1 teaspoon). Then place into your freezer and let it freeze overnight. Take the frozen container out of the freezer and let it thaw completely. Dump out lemon juice water and then rinse. The taste should be diminished.

2 ) Alternatively, you can fill the container up with milk (powdered milk works for this as well) and place it into the refrigerator for 24 hours. Then completely clean and dry the container. 

3) You can also use a Bottle Bright tablet and soak it with warm water for 30+ minutes. Then empty and rinse the reservoir or container, scrubbing it with a bristle brush. Rinse once more, completely and let dry fully prior to using.

4) For those that are extra sensitive to taste, we recommend using a Nuun tablet or a drop or two of lemon juice in their reservoir or container during activity. 

If these solutions do not work for you, please let us know!

review.reviewBody: Use this ultralight backing, climbing, MT biking. Durable, doesn’t from my hands.
review.name: SoftFlask 250ml

review.reviewBody: These are simply brilliant to add on for big race sections with several hourse between aid stations in the heat. As I had hoped, they fit in the side pockets of my Nathan hydration pack; so I can use them on the fly without stopping. Perfect comfort against the body. But otherwise would be perfect to stash in the main compartment or you could even secure them to your body via a waist pack belt, which I also trialed successfully. Even 1 would be a nice boost, but two, or 17oz, is really a nice insurance policy to add on to your main hydration plan and easily could be the difference between a DNF or not; or more importantly between feeling good vs. getting dangerously dry. LOVE the flip cap to keep the nozzle clean. Great flow and zero leakage even with squeezing it. Should last forever but I stocked up on these.
review.name: Gold For Big AS Gaps!

review.reviewBody: Product had a hole in it right out of the box and leaked.
review.name: Had a pin hole leak right out of the box
comment:
Hello,

We apologize for that! Please fill out a warranty claim to get a replacement product. I will link it below
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=913128 

Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used 250 ml SoftFlask for two longer (4+ hour) rides and it’s performed flawlessly, with no leaks. I’ve found it to actually be cleaner and more efficient than toting around a pocket full of single use plastic packaged gels and their sticky empties.
review.name: More goo, less plastic

review.reviewBody: Love your brand thank you so much staff for your time and guidance
review.name: Hydrapak is number one thank you again

name: SoftFlask 250ml Water Bottle

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have been using the Riff 15 for over a year now, and am thrilled to report it is just as lofty and luxurious as it was on day 10. 
I love this bag and have been the envy of friends on several occasions due to the extra space the Riff affords me (over a traditional mummy bag). I love the pocket for my fillo pillow (I have the luxe and it fits well enough) also allowing me to tuck my puffy jacket in there to add extra height. I have also experienced condensation during the springtime in NE and the footbox has done a good job of rejecting the water droplets that gather at night. 
My only negative is that this bag is more narrow than I'd like for base camping/several days on site so I am thinking of picking up a larger option for those occasions with the new Endless Promise line. With products like this and an environmental focus like Nemo has you wont catch me with another company’s sleep system when I'm looking for balance of durability and comfort. Truly this bag is the perfect mix of packable and luxe. Well done, Nemo!
review.name: Comfort & Super Cozy Material- Small package!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this bag as an upgrade to a men's Disco 30 that is several years old. I got the women's long version since it's warmer than the men's version and the same size. I sleep cold, and the lower comfort rating of the women's version really sealed the deal for me. I've only used it once so far and the nights got down to about 30 degrees. The bag is great, very cozy, I love the foot box.
review.name: Fantastic Upgrade

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for two primary reasons...weight and zipper location.  I'm a 74 yr old male that sleeps on my right side. The women's bag zipper location on the right side eliminates the need to roll over to unzip the bag.  It is comfortable and warm!
review.name: Excellent Bag for Side Sleepers

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I picked one of these up for my wife, who is always cold.   Fit her very well and kept her warm all night.  The gills work perfect and the blanket fold really keeps the drafts out.
review.name: Snug as a bug

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: The gills are sheer genius!  This bag is such an upgrade to any sleep system.
review.name: So Cozy!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: The packability of this bag, the shape, the sustainability, are all such incredible features. Nemo products never cease to amaze me! The quality of this product is so high, and I’d recommend it to anyone, plus the spoon shape is such a game changer!!
review.name: My Favorite Bag I’ve Owned!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got this as a gift for my wife. She loves the real sleeping bag. Works great for what we do. Not too hot. Not too cold. We are a little fair weather, so not really below 30. Best part, the Nemo name.
review.name: Wife Finally Got a Real Sleeper

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not gonna lie.. I used this the same day I got it, and it was awesome. Nemo is really the best brand out there
review.name: Best purchase ever

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: My wife has been very pleased with this bag. She is a cold sleeper and hasn’t had any issues with being cold this winter in the southeast US.
review.name: Great, warm bag!

review.itemreviewed: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable backpacking sleeping bag I have owned.  I am a side sleeper and find I am able to move around in bag during the night and stay quite comfortable.  It does not weigh too much or take up too much room in my pack.  I like blanket fold and thermo gill features a lot.
review.name: Best Sleeping Bag!

name: Riff Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Women's

review.reviewBody: Took this boot out for a few big days of touring so far. Super light and flexible. The tongue/shell flaps can be a little difficult to align properly and the buckles are tight. I have normal size calves and can barely get them to close on the loosest setting. Other than that great lightweight boot!
review.name: Great AT boot!!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these about 1 month ago and being a long time Scarpa Maestrale user these are a substantial upgrade from the previous models of which I have had two.  Improved range of motion for uphilling as well as a solid progressive flex for downhill.  For my size, 155lbs, the flex of 110 seems to be perfect and driving a big ski should be no problem for these.  My only negative comment goes for Scarpa in general these days, hard to remove the liners to dry and then very hard re-inserting them. My older Maestrale's with the clamshell type side opening were much easier to deal with, otherwise very satisfied and a great price from Backcountry!
review.name: Substantial Updated Model

review.reviewBody: Love the boot, but the stock Intuition liner packed out after ten ski days to the point I have to crank down the instep strap and calf cuff to extreme positions, to keep from uncomfortable foot twist (which greatly irritates my knee). Dissapointing.
review.name: Maestrale

review.reviewBody: Once again, Scarpa does not disappoint. Solid boot, great range of motion while in walking mode, vibram soles grip like they should. Support like you would expect for any ski environment. True to size.
review.name: Bomb proof A/T boot

name: Maestrale Alpine Touring Boot - 2023

review.reviewBody: I loved my new Spyder Falline GTX Infinium women's jacket.  It kept me comfortably warm while skiing and on the lifts.  I am usually very cold when skiing, but not in this coat.  It has a pass pocket, but not venting at the armpit area, only at the front top shoulder.  Great coat, I am very satisfied and would purchase this coat again.  I purchased a large for my broad shoulders, but the stomach area could have been a medium.  so it is roomy

review.reviewBody: These pockets are so high they are impossible to use with a harness. For a climbing company, that's a pretty big design flaw! Also the pockets are so tight it's hard to get much into them. This is disappointing for anyone who works in the industry and regularly needs to get items into their pockets, or for ski touring when again, you need to fit items beyond a cellphone and a tiny snack into your pockets. And as soon as you're on a glacier with a harness - forget about the phone and snack, as the pockets become totally obsolete! It would be great to see next year's pants have lower pockets, as otherwise they are a great pant.
review.name: Why are the pockets so high? Please make them lower so I can use them with a harness on.

review.reviewBody: I love the beacon pocket on these pants! My beacon feels very secure and it is easy to get to. I purchased a size small online because that is the size I wear in any other brands of shell ski pants. These are very baggy on me, almost too baggy. It's nice that they have an adjustable belt, but I find that the belt slips during tours and my pants start sliding down. I might have to replace the belt and sew the length in place. They are also a tad longer than other size small shell pants I've owned, but I doesn't really bother me with my ski boots on. I probably could have easily gotten away with a size xs in these and I imagine they would still be plenty roomy, which is what I prefer in a shell pant. I couldn't find anywhere in my area to try them on, so I just had to send it. Overall I think these are amazing pants, but the sizing is definitely weird so try them on first if you can! For reference, I am 5'4" 115 lb with an athletic/non-curvy build.
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: I purchased these pants for the added protection over soft shell ski pants. I can still do a full squat and they keep me dry. My new favs!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: I was excited to receive my new pants and try them out. I have had them for 6 weeks and they are falling apart. The button on the lower pant leg fell out the first time I used it, and it's gone downhill since then. They have been used for light- minimal activity: mainly walking and a few cross country ski runs. Very disappointed. The fit was great, if not a little too big. Comfortable, flexible, warm...just low quality.
review.name: Low Quality

review.reviewBody: I’m so stoked on these pants! I bought them for work and they’ve kept me dry in pouring rain and wet snow. The fabric is holding up great to daily use. They’ve also got enough room for an extra layer for the cold days. Just wish they came with a shorter inseam option.
review.name: I’m so stoked on these

review.reviewBody: Excited to try out these new ski pants. They seem really durable, built to last and are comfortable and fit me really well. I'm 5'8" 135lb and tried the medium and small and found the small to fit perfectly, the mediums were definitely too roomy all over. The pants I had a lot of features I was looking for, including a belt and vents on the side. I do wish the vents had netting to keep the vent from totally gaping open. I also hope that BD will consider vents on both the inside and outside of the legs in the next iteration of these pants. Also hoping the beacon specific pocket was on the thigh in a cargo type pocket to get it that much farther away from my phone, which will obviously now be on my upper body, so that there's no interference.
review.name: Great fit and function

review.reviewBody: Last season, I bought the Recon bibs, which I love. So, this season I got the Recon pants for those days when I don't need bibs. I love the fit, style, comfort, quality, and performance in all conditions. And BD's excellent warranty is a plus, too. For reference, I'm 5'6" 135 lbs and ordered a S. When they arrived, I tried them on with a pair of insulated 3/4 puffy pants and knee pads, and the fit was still perfect.
review.name: Recon pants for the win

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had the old model for a long time. Love the new pockets and place for a phone. The stretch is fantastic. 
Bought the large, I’m 5,7”, 155lbs.
review.name: Love the changes

review.reviewBody: Ordered the small and the adjustable belt really helps the fit. Good pockets as well
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody:
I had these pants the last two seasons but never loved them. I have an athletic build with narrow hips and found they would always fall down as the built in belt isn't great. I blew through the crotch and then yesterday the seams fell apart on the butt. The cuffs are a STRUGGLE to get over my boots. Overall not long lasting quality but they filled a void of ski pants the last two seasons. Fairly comfy. 
Size small
Height 5 3
138lbs
review.name: So so

name: Recon Stretch Ski Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: They got great like all my other Chaco's . Lots of compliments on the tie dye color
review.name: Great , as always
comment: Awesome! Thanks for sharing Renee!

review.reviewBody: they love the colors- got them on sale for them to grow into and they want to wear them NOW! love all the fun designs they get to choose from. hope they feel good to them when they grow into them ( in the past, we have not been able to get the straps tight enough).
review.name: kiddos picked them out
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you for choosing Chaco!

review.reviewBody: I like the ZX/1 a little better, but the pattern and fit are good. These make my toes happy and support my arches well. Now, I am ready to play.
review.name: Happy feet
comment: We love happy feet! Thanks for sharing Kris!

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals and wear them every day all summer. This is my second pair of this exact shore. Note to the wise: kids size four is women’s size 7
review.name: My second pair!
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Robin!

review.reviewBody: Fits well & looks good. Stylin with my colors. Workin on the Chaco Tan... love my CHACOS got the Tie Dyed Chacos
review.name: Feelin Groovy
comment: They look awesome! Happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Fits at least a size bigger than expected. The tie straps drag on the ground as a result so I need to tuck them in. That said, they are still very comfortable and the straps are durable. No itches or scratches, good arch support, easy to keep clean, good grippy soles.
review.name: Fits big, still comfortable
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Jennifer!

review.reviewBody: I like these shoes, they are very cute, but they gave me blisters on my toe area. Ouch
review.name: Blisters!
comment: We appreciate your feedback Peyton. We appreciate your feedback. Discomfort while breaking in your new shoes is never fun. We typically recommend breaking them in at a slow pace by wearing them 1-3 hours at a time in non-strenuous conditions to allow your feet time to adjust to them. Just as everyone's feet are a little different, this process can vary for different people. Also, click the following link to see how to adjust your sandals to get the perfect fit. https://tinyurl.com/4mxt6p9x

review.reviewBody: Great sandal!  My 4yo can easily slip them on and off!  These are his new favorite shoes!
review.name: Great sandal

review.reviewBody: defect product when received and unable to adjust to foot
review.name: defect product

review.reviewBody: My son is 5, so I think they’re just a learning curve for him. I wouldn’t rate it a 4, but they were hard to adjust to a comfortable fit for him. However, I do think he needs to get used to this type of shoe, so I wouldn’t prevent anyone from buying these, especially if your child is pretty easygoing in the footwear department. My guy is picky with shoes, socks, seams, and that kind of thing.
review.name: Great shoes, I’m sure my little guy will adjust

name: Z/1 EcoTread Sandal - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I need a shoe with a hard sole because of orthotics. These are a perfect. They have a great look without looking sterile. The wide flat sole provides great stability and my orthotics fit without issue or discomfort. The sole is a light lug style but provides good grip and would work for any level. They are not steel toe but do have a toe scuff guard. They’re durable and have actually had a few comments on them.
review.name: Bought 2 pair

review.reviewBody:
I ordered an 11, but it was too long . I usually wear 11, but the 10.5 felt better. This shoe has a wide toe box, but it is very low volume. I have some pinching in the front of my foot, while the heel feels somewhat sloppy. 

I love these things around town. Oddly, it's almost a better bike shoes than approach shoe. But as far as getting out of the car and doing basic outdoor rec it fits the bill.
review.name: Interesting fit!

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe without having the chance to try it on. It is a very good-looking shoe in person. I have received several complimentary comments already on its appearance. It also appears to be well-made and should last a good while. My only issue is the very low volume toe box area. My size 11 has plenty of length and width in the toe box but it is very low in height which creates a cramped, pinching sensation at the tips and top of the toes. I have only worn them a half-dozen times and hoping it will stretch a bit with break-in. In the meantime I pulled the original insert that is thicker that most and replaced it with a thinner insert that I had laying around from another shoe. This has made all the difference in comfort. I will keep this setup unless the toe box does stretch and allow me to run the original inserts. Overall, I am now very happy with the shoes with this modification of swapping to a thinner insert.
review.name: Cool shoe but a little tight in the toes

review.reviewBody: I love the look of the shoe. They're similar to skateboard shoes both in fit and feel the soles are surprisingly less "grippy" than I would have expected for a shoe advertised for climbing potential, but overall I like them. My biggest complaint is sizing. I normally wear a 7.5 US/40 EU in most shoes but in this shoe, I definitely need an 8.
review.name: Decent shoe, just watch sizing.

review.reviewBody: Very grippy on rock and any other terrain besides packed snow. Highly durable and very warm. Not sure if they're too hot in the summer, but a great winter shoe so far.

These shoes are no joke. I just ordered my fourth pair in about 6 years. Why? The same shoes over and over? Not because I have no imagination... and it's not because I'm boring.  No, no... I'm rad. And I find that life's most savory spice is certainly variety. It's because these shoes have that versatility and durability to bring the spiciness of life. I wear them 365 days a year pretty much. Unless the only thing I wear that day is a snowboard boot. No matter what the day has in store, I slip my feet into these babies and I'm out the door. Hiking, mtn biking, welding, camping, canyoneering, dancing, skating, fancy dinner date (your mileage my vary). I'm a welder. I get the real leather ones because I work in them. Yes, I weld in these and let me tell you, steelwork is hard on EVERYTHING. I have to get all my work clothes from the thrift store cause I go through pants and flannels like coffee filters. Winter, spring, summer, fall. I live in a mountain town at 9,000ft. These shoes have the best soles I've ever walked icy snowy streets in AND my feet stay dry. I get about a year and a half out of each pair. I could get more out of them, but I'm not the dirtbag I once was. I don't wait till the soles are falling off and holes worn through. I've never had them blow out or anything. So, for those dirtbags out there, just keep wearing them they'll go as far as your Subaru will take you. I just like to look a little fresh so, I put them in the town free box for someone else to enjoy, and bust out the fresh pair I store in the closet, cause ya know, always be prepared.
review.name: Variety is the spice of life. These shoes bring it

review.reviewBody: Awesome shoe. Fit really tight for the first few hours and then fit perfectly after a very short break-in. I ordered a 10.5 which is my normal shoe size. Such a great shoe that I've already ordered a second pair only 1 week later...
review.name: Rebel is a great shoe right out of the box

review.reviewBody:
Size 10 vans (eras) fit me flawlessly -- the size 10 Rebels were a smidge too long. Width was perfect, but I had a bit of space at the toe end with my heels at the back. 

THAT SAID, I'm a long-time boulderer and I prefer a pretty precise fit as far as length. If you like a looser fit, these may be true to size for you. I am going to try a 9.5, so a half size down from my vans, to see if I can get a precision length fit. I can always loosen the laces if they are a bit narrow.
review.name: Pretty Fly

review.reviewBody: Fantastic kicks! Super comfy straight out of the box and stylish ta boot. I'll definitely be getting another pair.

Great shoe!  Wanted something that doesn't look and scream, I'm a rock climber!  These fit the bill.  It's like wearing a pair of Van's but you can actually hike and scramble in these.  Fit is true and feels great.  Had an old Cruiser from Evolv that were pretty narrow and ended up blowing out of those on the side.  These won't have those issues and seem really well made and durable materials.  Think I may get a second color.
review.name: Full on tech but looks of street

name: Rebel Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these sunglasses. I’ve super sun-sensitive eyes. It can be distressing when I am driving toward the bright sun. These sunglasses really dim the sun. I look forward to wearing them on my walks home from work. I also think that the color when wearing them can be super vibrant. 💯.
review.name: For sun-sensitive eyes

review.reviewBody: From slopes to streets, these shades are effortlessly cool! No regrets.
review.name: So sleek, so stylish

review.reviewBody: Didn’t like how the glasses looked when they arrive so I sent them back.
review.name: Not my favorite Sunski glasses.
comment: Sorry to hear that! We're always trying new things so stay tuned ;)

review.reviewBody: My favorite color is the gold with tortoise frame - flashy but understated, which is exactly how I feel when ripping around the mountain.  What I absolutely love is the comfort and finishing details - like, no expense has been spared with ensuring that these glasses stay exactly where you want them to no matter how sendy you get.  I really don't think there is a better looking, better performing pair of backcountry shades on the market.  Sunski has put this to bed and I am willing to throw 'bows on it
review.name: my gosh do I love these

review.reviewBody: I'm obsessed with the white! These sunglasses on are iconic. I get so many compliments on my new Strada sunglasses. I wear them around town, on hikes and can't wait to rock them this winter in the snow. They are so versatile and look cool with or without the leather centerpiece and sun shields. Buy them now, you won't regret it!
review.name: Iconic Sunglasses

name: Strada Polarized Sunglasses

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect, lightweight backpack essential for boiling water for more than one meal/beverage at a time. Cups and bowls are A+
review.name: Sturdy & lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packability is superb. Haven't had the chance to use yet, but definitely looking forward to the extra space in the pack. The reversible handle seems well made. I wonder if the handle will get really hot while cooking? I'm hoping the next gen design, in regards to the handle and lid, will allow for a more snug fit while in travel mode. The lid seems to have a tendency to sneak past the handle. Nonetheless, excellent design!
review.name: Packable, funcitonal, and lightweight!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This set is awesome.  It’s perfect for campers.  It fits together nicely and you can move from pot to bowl easily, cleanup is a cinch, and storage space is great.  Would buy more from this brand
review.name: Camping win

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely loving this multi-piece one pot cook set! Everything fits into the pot (as stated), which makes it way too easy to cart around with you wherever ya go.

The pot worked well to cook with and everything was easy to clean and pack back up.

Love me some sea to summit!
review.name: Portable and worth it!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this item complimentary in exchange for my honest review. I really enjoyed this pot, bowls and cups. The first time I used them was during a 44 hour power outage to heat up some soup lol but it got the job done and was so convenient. Had great heat distribution and was super easy to clean. I really enjoy it and can’t wait to use on an actual camping adventure 😂
review.name: Gets the job done!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this camping set! Super fun colors and easy to store for when you are ready to take a trip. Easy to clean, easy to carry, and durable. I love how it all stacks together and locks into place. Highly recommend!
review.name: Durable and fun!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like how compact this cook set is. The pot is durable and a decent size. The cups are so cute and flexible to use for anything. The pot cooked my rice perfectly with no issues.
review.name: I would take this camping :))))

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice lightweight set that can all be contained and secured inside itself. Easily can be attached to the outside of a pack. Because of its key lightweight feature I’m not sure how durable the pot would be in knocked around a bit but the cups and bowls feel like strong unbreakable material. I haven’t gotten to use it yet just because I have camped yet but it’s seems like an overall great set.
review.name: Perfect for keeping the load light

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Frontier UL One Pot Cook Set is a fantastic addition to any outdoor adventure. This 5-piece set includes a 2L Frontier Pot made from high-quality hard-anodized aluminum alloy, ensuring efficient heat transfer. The pot features a ceramic non-stick coating, clever strainer holes in the lid, and a LidKeep system that allows you to clip the lid to the side of the pot. The Click-Safe handle provides a solid grip and can be reversed to hold the entire cookset in place. Along with the pot, you get ergonomic Passage Collection bowls and cups, which are ultra-durable and perfect for any adventure. The compact design ensures it won’t take up much space in your backpack, and the lightweight construction makes it ideal for camping, hiking, or backpacking.
review.name: Compact for camping

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this set!  The pot is a great size and has a measurements line inside as well as the cups. This makes it very convenient. A huge plus is that everything fits inside the pot and seals tightly for traveling.
review.name: Awesome for camping and picnics!

name: Frontier UL One Pot 5-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person

description: Buy the Wild Country Syncro Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Syncro Harness
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Syncro Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've always been a fan of WC's harnesses. I wore out an old session women's and bought a new one along with Syncro. I was drawn to Syncro because it's advertised as unisex with biiig gear loops. I was hoping this harness can make my long trad day more comfortable. However, even though the size chart says the S/M would fit 67cm/26inches waist (i'm about 27inches), the harness can't stay above my iliac crest with a double rack and keeps rubbing against my bone and eventually leaving bruises. Yeah,  that happened after a long day at Red Rocks and again at Indian Creek. Would still recommend if the sizing fits you.
review.name: I really want to love it if the size isn't too big

review.reviewBody: Excellent Harness!  Very comfortable. I wish the gear loops were separated more...meaning that they didn't overlap as much.  But not a deal breaker!
I love the woven look of this harness The leg loops are super comfortable, I’m looking forward to putting more vertical miles on it.

name: Syncro Harness

review.reviewBody: Just got these overalls in black and olive. The fabric seems very durable and the zipper & buttons feel tough. M was a good choice for my 40” hips. However I’m a 5’1” shortie and what drew me to these overalls were how the shoulder straps have two parts - the stretchy front part and the canvas back part (most visible on the brown & green color overalls). I just opened up some seams and removed the canvas part of the strap, sewing the stretchy piece in its place so it now comprises the shoulder straps. This mod makes them fit great on my short frame and took me just a half hour to do. Thanks Stoic for inadvertently making some very modifiable overalls!
review.name: Needed altering but great otherwise!

review.reviewBody: Ordered these having not tried Stoic brand before. Was unsure about sizing, but took a chance with the XL. Ended up fitting like a dream! Great combination of stretch and heavyweight material. Normally wear 16-18 or 2X bottoms. Love the side zipper and style of closure for overall. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Quality and Great Style

review.reviewBody: Just like the pictures. I ordered the dark green. Very comfortable and classy. True to size; I ordered an XL bc I wasn't sure but a large would've been fine in L.
review.name: Well made and comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I don’t know about anyone else, but me? I have certain clothing items that are perfect, my favorites & this makes the cut. Fit, color, cut, price & feel (does it bring me joy😆) These are such high quality in every way. I got the olive color and it’s so rich & heavy duty.  Backcountry blew me away with their shipping. Holy cow it feels like I ordered it and the next time I opened my door there it was, talk about expedited shipping at no extra cost🤩. This is my first order, you will see this review on every item I purchased and I will be buying from
Backcountry again and again.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
To be completely honest, I fell in love with these the second I put them on. The material is super soft and stretchy. Feels durable enough but I could see the knees wearing through quickly if that is a common issue for you.

Unfortunately, unlike other Stoic products, the "Stretch Limo" color is not a true black in these. The overalls are more of a dark graphite, rendering them useless to me as I need to wear black clothing for work. Thus I regrettably had to return them. If Backcountry comes out with these in black, I'll snap them up in a heartbeat.

For reference, I am a size medium in Duluth overalls and the large Venture overalls fit me well.
review.name: Super Comfy, Disappointed by Color

review.reviewBody: I love my venture overalls!  Great design and fit.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody:
These are so cute, got the Grey corduroy for winter, and now these for summer!
Legs- loose and comfy, Straps-thick and comfy, Pockets- galore, filled with gardening tools!
#backcountrygearhead
review.name: Perfect Bibs!

review.reviewBody:
I have half dozen rides in these pants, they fit awesome.  True to size.
Good stretch, might have to get a 2nd paid
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit - not too much fabric, nice stretch, breathable and clean-up well. I’ve used them in cool to cold conditions, including wet, and they’ve been very comfortable. The No-Snap waist closure adjusts easily and is quick to open and close. Pockets are decently sized. All-in-all, a well-designed, functional product.
review.name: Excellent MTB Pants

review.reviewBody:
I had been looking for a pair of pants that can fit some one with the extra pounds that I have. After trying TLD and Fox, I must say that these pants fit me perfect and comfortable. They are not a low-rise types of pants and they fit right at the waist level without any discomfort.
I highly recommend these pair of pants to those people that like the traditional fit and feel of pants.

I will try to follow up this review after a few more rides with them!!
review.name: Amazing MTB Trousers

review.reviewBody:
I've tried a number of different riding pants and a lot of them fell short for me, usually because of some blend of being too short in length, so they ride up on one's legs, and poorly designed waists, so I was always having to yank them back up while riding. Some suffered from excessive stretch in the hip and waist area, which typically exacerbated the aforementioned issues.

Needless to say, I was pleasantly surprised by how awesome these pants are. Fit is top-notch and true to size. Length is perfect for me at 6'3" and 33" inseam, these are long enough to cover short socks, without bunching. They have an excellent balance of stretch, without it being overkill, especially in the waist and hip area - so they stay up well in aggressive riding. The click-belt and Velcro tabs on the waist work well to adjust fit, based on what you're wearing. Having a fly helps with bio breaks.

About the closest thing these pants could be said to have in the way of shortcomings would be they won't be breathable enough for warm/hot weather for some people, which I don't mind because I bought them for cool weather wearing, and they have less pockets than some brands of pants.

Would definitely recommend these and will be buying more soon.
review.name: Awesome MTB pants

name: MT500 Burner Pant - Men's

comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: This was everything I wanted and seems it would be super warm.  I read the reviews and understood it ran small, so thought I planned it right by ordering a small (I am slender/athletic frame, 5'4" + 120 lbs) but it is tight across the chest area - all else was great.     My one reason for sending the review is to help others with size selection.  The medium is sold out, but would probably be much too room across the hips for me anyways.
review.name: Loved the coat but tight across chest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice coat and I agree with many of the reviews I've read regarding sizing.  I am a petite older woman who weighs less than 95 pounds.  I have both an XS and a S in this jacket.  The XS is snug thru the chest and shoulders but it fits well if I only wear a base layer or something thin underneath.  It's great for walking the dogs in the winter time.  I just purchased a size S and it fits over a sweater or fleece top and it does not overwhelm me or look too big on my frame plus it's nice not feeling restricted thru the chest and shoulders.  I really like this coat for it's warmth to weight ratio and it looks like a quality product that will hold up well for a number or years.
review.name: Nice Coat, Can be Snug Thru Chest/Shoulders

review.reviewBody: I was so excited when I received this jacket. I thought it was flattering, warm, and had so many great features. However I've only had it for two weeks, using it very lightly - and the feathers are coming out everywhere. I am so disappointed that I wasted my money.
review.name: Poor Quality
comment: Hello, thank you for leaving the review on our product. We're really sorry that it didn't fully meet your expectations on this occasion. We are happy to assist in resolving all issues with any of our products. If you require further assistance, don't hesitate to get in touch with us via the website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: After being through several pairs of sandals that I wasn't a fan of I stumbled across Luna. The Oso Flaco in particular seemed to be the perfect sandal on paper. If you enjoy a minimalist fit and low profile feel then these are for you. they are incredibly comfortable for how thin they are and easy to adjust the fit for optimal lockdown on the heel. The vibram sole is great if you need to take these on a trail or anywhere that requires a bit of extra grip. Fit feels true to size. I wear an 11 in street shoes and got a size 11 in these and have no complaints so far. I believe Luna was born from a running background, and while I have not used these sandals for running, I have used them on my bike and walked several miles in them at a time with no issues.
review.name: Fantastic Sandals!

review.reviewBody: Bigger cam sizes are floppy
review.name: Floppy

review.reviewBody: These things don't get enough credit.  They are incredibly light, flex well in horizontal placements (somewhere between an alien and a c4), and have a fantastic trigger action.  Yes, the colors are unique and no thumb loop, but its incredibly simple to learn. For the value and quality, these are fantastic cams from a great company.
review.name: The Bomb.com

review.reviewBody:
I have a few of these to fill the gaps between BD c4's/x4's and I really like them, but I wish they had thumb loops, like they used to.  The yellow #2 is slightly smaller than a BD 0.4 X4, and the orange #3 is slightly larger than the BD 0.4 X4, but smaller than the BD 0.5 C4.  The red #4 also lands between a BD 0.5 and 0.75 C4.  Having these to fill the gaps of a BD C4 rack has been so nice.

I knocked a star off because they don't have thumb loops and when you fully engage the trigger, at the very end of the lobe rotation, the camming distance actually expands a tiny bit.  This means that if you have a tendency to overcam your placements and it happens to be at the narrowest point, then pulling the trigger will actually make the head expand that tiny bit and you end up with a cam that's pretty friggin stuck.
Also, if you get the bigger sizes, the heads are heavy for the cable, so it ends up being wobbly and more difficult to place.  

So it's not perfect, but I really love the yellow/orange/red sizes and they are always on me when heading up routes in the northeast.
review.name: great cam, wish they had thumb loops

review.reviewBody:
Update
Still love them, have a double rack have had zero issues with the cams happy with my decision!


Out of the box. Amazing action, super light(obviously) sturdy, confidence inspiring. 

Sold the doubles in my C4 rack and purchased 00-6 recently and can't wait to get on some more finger cracks with better gear then I was using. I'll update in a few weeks when they get some good use.
review.name: Update* First impression

review.reviewBody:
Originally wanted tcus when I started working on cams. A few wise old climbers told me you'll save money in the long run if you just get Totems, master cams, skip the hexes, and run from tcus. I listened on the hexes ( hint: tricams ) and tcus, then penny pinched a mixed rack of c4's / master cams I gradually got on sale. 


Since then used or owned most of the newer cams, except dragons. they don't stick / give confidence like master cams or totems. Only cams I've found to stick better are totems black to orange and, personal preference only,  dragonflies smaller 0.0 - 0.2 range. A great primary or double rack. 


yellow master cam kinda = yellow totem = pink tricam
review.name: What you get before totems

review.reviewBody: I have the 00,0,1 sizes and I love how solid they feel when you place them. I took my first trad whipper on the 1 after the nut above popped out. My confidence in them skyrocketed!!
review.name: Love the smaller sizes

name: Ultralight Master Cam

review.reviewBody:
I just spent 19 days on the JMT with this pack and so have enough experience to really review it. To give you my background, I own five large capacity backpacks and have done 50+ miles on one trip a year for several years now and I run outdoor programs as part of my job. I got this pack about a month from my JMT hike because of the longer torso option.

To answer the big question I had, this pack can fit the BV 500 upright and the Bearikade Weekender horizontally -but you’ll really struggle to get it in and out of the pack so I carried it upright as well. These bear canisters will leave enough room for your tent and pad next to them (if upright -see pic) with room to shove in jackets and other small items. If I had carried the Bearikade horizontally, I would have put my tent in a side pocket or strapped it to the bottom of the pack.

PROs:
-I LOVE the side zipper more than I thought I would. I kept my rain jacket and cover next to the zipper and it was always easy to grab them for afternoon storms without pulling apart the pack or having to keep them in an outer pocket.
-I am so happy a company is making packs for women with long torsos. If you are like me with problems getting a women’s pack to fit, this is probably going to work for you. I’m not quite 5’10” but I have a torso that is just over 21” -most manufacturers think women’s torsos max out at around 20”. This pack fit like a dream and had enough structure that heavy loads didn’t change the fit. 
-The strap keepers are both amazing and annoying. I plan to buy a bunch of them to add to my other packs, but they aren’t quite big enough for the waist strap and were annoying on the two straps that hold down the brain given that I regularly needed to adjust those as I ate through a food resupply and moved items into my bear canister to use up empty space. I never took them off those two straps, but I probably will for future long hikes. They were super helpful for all other straps on the pack so I put them on the list of pros.
-The back outside pocket is spacious and the cords and straps help to hold things down really well. The lack of a back outer pocket was a major deal breaker for me with another pack I own when considering which to use for the JMT.
-The brain has just enough organization and room to be helpful. I was able to keep my wallet, keys, and other critical items in the zippered pocket and still have the things I needed regularly on hand in the main section. The loops on the outside made it really easy to attach my solar panel and charge my battery while hiking. 
-I was not gentle with this pack and it held up beautifully. I got the white color and my hiking friends regularly commented on how it didn’t look as dirty as they expected it to. Of course the bottom and pocket where I kept my camp shoes got fairly brown over the course of the hike, but I live in the desert and didn’t want a black pack.
-The back outside pocket isn’t flexible, but it is capacious. I could stuff my sit pad, bidet, trowel, pee funnel, wet groundcloth, wet pack cover, and more in there easily and never felt that I didn’t have enough room. The fabric also makes it more sturdy than pockets made from stretchier material.


CONs:
-The compression straps that make it easy to cinch the bag down when it is less full can make it tricky to use the side pockets for larger items -they catch on the straps when they are at the limit of wha will fit -it’s annoying, but not a deal breaker. I do wish the side pocket openings were maybe an inch larger in diameter and a little baggier toward the bottom. You can fit two smart water bottles in a pocket, but I struggled to fit a bottle and my cold soak container (a mug just a tiny bit bigger than the classic gelato containers many use) in one pocket and my camp shoes needed to go in before I filled the main part of the bag.
-The Mystery Ranch rain cover that should fit based on pack capacity really doesn’t fit if you are filling the  outer pockets. I made it work, but I also made sure that the items in the side pockets could get wet since  it didn’t cover them perfectly. Size up  or go with a different brand cover.
-I also tried to add on a Mystery Ranch sidekick and it didn’t work well for me -it just wasn’t comfortable. I ended up using an older pocket I had from another company.
-The biggest annoyance with this pack is that the fabric rubs on the frame at the top of the pack. I took the pack on several gear shakedown hikes and was convinced that I just needed to figure out the best way to load things, but I realized that I could make the noise just by pulling lightly on the load lifters even when the bag is empty. The noise is loud enough that people around me could hear it and I found it really annoying some days and would drown it out with music.

For me, if they can figure out the squeaking noise, this is a great bag with a few minor issues. Maybe I got an odd bag and the others don’t make the noise. I would make sure you give the pack a few months to see if your pack squeaks before committing to using this bag on a longer hike.
review.name: Used on JMT -good with some annoying things

name: Radix 57L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
This Sunshade is an excellent choice for either sun exposure or rain.
It is definitely not designed for use in anything rougher than a gentle breeze.
I wouldn’t set it up and walk away for any length of time but if you’re on scene and able to pay attention to any wind and its effects on the Sunshade you will be fine. Might have to take it down if the gusts begin to deform the shape. The large Sunshade will cover an 8 foot long picnic table. A real sanctuary from either the sun or rain…!

hasVariant.name: Roadtrip 24in XLT Griddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Roadtrip 24in XLT Griddle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely horrible.  I bought this 6 months ago, seasoned it, and cooked on it once and it is completely broken from what I can tell.  The regulator is cracked causing it to leak propane, but since it's all one piece, I can't just replace the regulator and I can't find a name or item number for the rest of the assembly.
review.name: Junk
comment:
Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that your RoadTrip™ Griddle XLT is broken after only one use. We take quality control very seriously, and we would like to check this further. Your comments are invaluable to us, and we will take them into consideration.

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.

Wishing you a lovely day!

review.reviewBody: Got as a gift. The box was slightly damaged, the right side would not ignite. After using 3 times the right side knob melted so you can’t turn it on and off. Both hinges on the lid would not slow the lid to close right.
review.name: Not worth the money

review.reviewBody: Purchased new in box, but must have been dropped because the lid was warped, one side of rivets were in and the other side were not. The latch will not close on one side due to the warped lid. There is some rust already on the top edge of the griddle. Not sure how long it will last.
review.name: Problems right out of the box

review.reviewBody: Absolutely LOVE our griddle!!!  Fun to cook on and easy to clean up!!!
review.name: LOVING OUR GRIDDLE!!!

review.reviewBody: Overall We love this grill. We've used it 4-5 times since we purchased it and has made great food every time. Our only complaint is the stand/wheels. There needs to be a clip or lock that prevents the stand from falling out from under the grill. I will likely drill through the red hoop on the bottom of the grill so I can bolt the stand in place.
review.name: Great grill but wheels/stand could use some work.

review.reviewBody: Looks like it should work well.  However, assembly was a bit of a disappointment.  First, the griddle is off level by about 1.5 inches.  I'll be able to fix that with some wood.  Looks like the legs with the feet are a bit too long.  The lever to lock the wheels is off by about 1/2 and inch, it should be higher on the leg to properly engage.  I'll be able to run a new hole in the leg and get it aligned but that should be correct from the beginning.  Oh, and the leg lock was originally installed on the wrong side and had to be moved to the correct leg.  Otherwise assembly was fine.  The cooking surface is sturdy and looks good.  Recommend?  Maybe.. lets see how it cooks but I'll have to say yes below b/c there is no maybe button.
review.name: Needs engineering help
comment:
Hello Moe NY. Thank you for reaching out to us and taking the time to provide feedback on our product. We are very sorry to hear that you having a hard time setting up the Roadtrip Grill. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your negative experience with our product. We will make sure to take note of your feedback for review. We are always looking for ways to better our product and services, and your feedback would certainly help us in improving it moving forward.

If you have other concerns about your product, such as its warranty, please visit the Coleman website, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, select contact us, and you will be directed to our contact form. Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this griddle on the go!! Its was super easy to put together. It is also really easy to clean off the griddle. I also love how it folds down so you can travel with it!!  It really cooks the food well. The only problem I had with this is the grease draining.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't get enough of my Coleman Roadtrip Griddle XLT. The quality of this let's me know it will last for years if I properly maintain it. I've made steaks, bacon, pork chops, eggs, and pancakes. Its folding feature makes it easy to put up, and grab quickly when it's purpose is desired.
review.name: The best road trip accessory ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this Coleman Roadrtip griddle. It's easy to set up out of the box. The carbon steel griddle cooks great and holds enough food for our big family without having to wait forever. This griddle is easy to clean and folds up when not in use. It's easy to transport, so you can take it to the lake, park or wherever you like. You will need one of the little fuel tanks for it.
review.name: Awesome griddle

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so glad I got this grill. The griddle cooks evenly and is truly non stick. I love how easily it folds up, and how sturdy it is when it's set up. Since it uses the small propane canisters you can take it anywhere, and not have to worry about starting charcoal, or lugging around a big tank.
 I just wish the grease drain was designed a little better. When cooking the grease pools up along the edges instead of going down the drain.
review.name: A camping must

name: Roadtrip 24in XLT Griddle

review.itemreviewed: EXP Series Anything Cradle Top-Load Kit
review.reviewBody: I just got back from a 3-day trip with the Top load cradle and pouches - the cradle is solid as our the brackets that hold it. The straps are great. The pouch fits my sleeping bag and puffy. My problem was that the pouch was too wide for my drop bars - on my Salsa Warbird. I moved the brake levers out as wide as I could without rewrapping the handlebar tape, and lowered the rack - but still had to struggle to shift (to the bigger chain ring up front and the smaller gears on the rear cassette). Check your measurements to be sure it will fit the rig.

review.reviewBody: Got this as a durable car camping tent that could hold up with two dogs, and after a few uses it definitely fits the bill. The tent fabric is durable and the inside is super spacious. My only issue with the tent is ventilation. It could really use some kind of vent towards the top of the fly, instead of the little ones near the doors that don't seem to do anything. With both fly doors closed, we woke up with a fair amount of condensation. Sleeping with them open was great, but obviously that isn't always possible depending on weather. Overall, it's a great tent that seems like it will last awhile, just wish it had a bit more airflow.

Have yet to go camping with it. My observations from setting it up are:
- Tent itself is easy to set up, clips make it a snap.
- The poles are rather flimsy, not sure how they'll perform in harsh wind storms.
- There are times when a surprise rain makes you have to scurry around in the middle of the night to throw the fly on. This fly is a bit of a pain to get on, and needing two extra poles for the fly is annoying. Not something you want to deal with in the middle of the night. 
- The stuff sack is barely large enough to get the tent, poles and fly in, there's no room for the ground tarp (footprint)! Will have to get another stuff bag that all will fit into.

Not sure I'll keep it, the cons are outweighing the pros so far.
review.name: Seems like a decent tent, time will tell

review.reviewBody: OK. But kind of a let down. I like the concept of the vestibules. The aluminum poles seem fairly flimsy and prone to be easily bent. The floor is rather thin, so a ground mat is mandatory to help prevent inevitable puncture to the thin floor. Biggest complaint is you basically have to set up two tents to have one. It's useless without the rainfly because of the porous and see-through mesh on sides and top. The rainfly it so big and requires so many ties down hooks It's like setting up another tent over the existing one. I get it's supposed to be secure and prevent rain infiltrating the tent. So in that regard it is well designed. But the rainfly better do a darn good job repelling water because you have only one line of defense with this tent due to the mesh top and sides.
review.name: I really want to like this tent. We'll see.

review.reviewBody: The tent is well made- fly extends to bottom of tent walls- great price!

Because the fly poles run perpendicular and on top of the tent poles, the fly poles create a lip for water to flow over. Water ends up pooling on the fly and you need to shake the tent to get the water to drain off the fly. This is annoying because if it rains in the night water just sits on the fly all night long. I am sure this will result in an issue with leakage in the future in these locations.
review.name: Fly design flaw

comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. Feedback is greatly appreciated especially on our newer products! I will be sure to share this with the team.

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased this Eureka Kohana 4 tent from Backcountry via eBay.  I was attracted to this tent's rugged fabric, burly aluminum poles, and very thick waterproof coating.  I have purchased other Eureka tents in the past and have been very happy with their performance and value.  At first sight and inspection, the Eureka Kohana tents seem like great, solid tents.  Unfortunately, the Eureka Kohana 4 and 6 person tents are brand new products from Eureka for 2021.  Like many brand new products,  these tents have their share of flaws and defects.  I found this out the hard way while camping a couple times in my new Eureka Kohana 4 tent during some steady rainstorms.

The primary design defect concerning the Eureka Kohana tents concern multiple leaks emanating from the rain fly in the dual vestibule areas.  There are two areas in the rain fly portion of each of the two vestibules that cause the annoying slow leakage of water into the tent during rainstorms.  Again, these leaks occur in BOTH sides of the tents in the vestibule areas.  These four total leaks then slowly drip water down onto the mesh doors of each side of the tents.  The drops of water pass through the mesh of the doors and then drip onto the tent's floor.  You then end up with four separate puddles of water in the tent (two on each side) near the doors. 

 This problem is not limited to only the Eureka Kohana 4 person tent.  Look at the review of the Eureka Kohana 6 person tent (by Richard I.  dated  4/25/21) on this Backcountry site.  You will find that the Eureka Kohana 4 and Kohana 6 tents are both plagued with leaks.  Unless you enjoy constantly mopping up four separate puddles of water IN your tent, stay far away from these two defective tents.  Eureka needs to work the "bugs" out of both these brand new model tents.  Even though Eureka has taped all the seams in the rain fly of these tents, they STILL leak.  Even though I applied a seam sealant to the external seams on the rain fly of my Kohana tent, it STILL leaks.  There is not way to remedy the leakage problem in the Kohana tents.  They truly suffer from a serious design defect.  An upper end brand new Eureka tent should not leak at all.  Buyer beware!
review.name: Leaks like a sieve...

name: Kohana 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Ordered these boots, received them and come to find out they had been used and had edge scuffing on the plastic and hinge points from ski edges and were covered up with a black magic marker. After repackaging I noticed dog prints on the outside of the box for the boots. Contacted BC and they said they would give me a $20 refund if I kept the boots. Very poor customer service from BC and I am through buying from there companies.
review.name: Back country sent me used boots !

review.reviewBody: I owned 3 previous pairs of the RS all at 29.5 (2016,19,21?) and they all fit well and similarly. I was hesitant to take the descriptions recommendation that these fit small when buying into my 4th pair but sure enough, I ended up returning the 29.5s and going to a 30.0. No turns on them yet, but out of the box they feel as good and familiar as the last 3. I expect good things.
review.name: They do run small

review.reviewBody: Last season I decided to upgrade my aging and well-loved Maestrale's for a new pair of RS's.  The new RSs performed well for several months  -- and then the liners started falling apart around the ankle.  Since the boots were less than one year old and had been used for only ~30 days, I sent them back to Scarpa on a warranty claim only to be told that having the liners develop holes after less of a season of normal use didn't make them defective so Scarpa wouldn't replace them.  Maybe I'm old fashioned but I expect the liners in an $850 boot to last for at least a full year.  Scarpa's quality just isn't what it used to be and they won't stand behind their products.  Buyer beware.
review.name: Not the Maestrale of Old

review.reviewBody: Seriously, buy it, this is the best ski boot I have ever owned. I had the Freedom RS before these for 5 years and wasn't sure I could find a boot I would like more but these are the next step and worth the upgrade. Large range of motion, easy on and off, comfy liner, grippy soles, stiff flex but can be forgiving if kept not so tight on the buckles, warm, light... the list goes on these boots are durable and perfect for any one who tours a lot but also likes to rage the resort! I don't have anything negative to say about these boots excpet that the shells tounge takes a little to get use to at first but its as easy as keeping the tongue below the buckles and your good to go!
review.name: BEST BOOT EVER!

name: Maestrale RS Alpine Touring Boot - 2023

review.reviewBody: I’ve had many disappointments buying bike gear over the past year, with many trips to the post office and FedEx to send back items that were poorly made or had been overhyped by the marketing department. Not the case here!  This expensive, but of very high quality. The fit is excellent though not as roomy as the advertising suggests. (I purchased a medium, my true size, and it fit perfectly.)  There’s a lot of attention to detail in the cuffs, the neck and hood, and the very welcome chest pocket sadly missing in other garments. The only note of caution I would sound is, while this is packable and can be stored in your saddle or handlebar bag, it is not a garment that folds down like a shakedry jacket, for example. There is more substance to this than to that type of garment. Yes, it’s costly, but worth it, and seems very durable. I hope to ride with it for years to come.
review.name: Top Quality Rain Jacket

name: EcoLyte Elite Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this tape because of an exhaustive search that didn't yield fruit for the Specialized S-wrap Roubaix, which would have gone great on my 2022 Roubaix, but anyhoo. I finally got around to applying this tape today and my initial impression was that I was sold some old merch since the adhesive, or at least the sticky part in the middle of the roll, wasn't very sticky. After consulting a video to refresh my mind for the install, I got to work. Immediately found this tape to be extremely easy to work with and so great to stretch and make work. Best part is the lack of stickiness is a bonus, because if you mess up, just unravel and do it again, just don't mess up the final cut at the top of your bars, like I kinda did. Once finished, the tape looks great, a little understated, feels good in the hands, and reasonably comfortable. Haven't taken a ride yet, but I know this tape is going to serve me well. Even the cheap seeming end plug went in and stayed in nice and tight. Great buy, just wish there were a larger variety of colors to choose from.
review.name: Great application experience!

review.reviewBody: Great Value, especially for the price.  Tape is supple and has a "foamy" feel.  It holds up and the colors are great.
review.name: Great Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: I wore la sportiva TX4 R and TX4 in 45, Hoka Mafate Speed 4 (US 11.5), but 45 in Akasha II is too tight and narrow, tried 45.5 and it's fine.
review.name: 1/2 size UP

review.reviewBody: Possibly the most versatile trail shoe for running or hiking. Great for long distance and technical terrain in any season
review.name: Best mountain running shoe on the market

review.reviewBody:
It's really hard to find very good fitting shoes. So I was really surprised how perfect they fit . I did also try La Sportiva Ultra Raptor II and they were even a little better, butI still  decided to go with this one. They don't dissapoint. I took them for 8 miles hike in rocky terrain  when I often hike. So I could compare them to various shoes I did use before
And they are very comfortable. 

I always buy hiking or running shoes in number 9 but this I really HAVE to go with 9.5 
That's never happened with any shoes I did use before.
review.name: Love the comfort

review.reviewBody:
Simply put this is the best all-around long distance running and hiking shoe I have found. I have 30k's on aggressive terrain and backpacked off-trail in these.

Great shoe.
review.name: Best Shoe Ever?

review.reviewBody:
This was my training and racing shoe for a season of long, steep, mountain races. While a bit on the heavier side it doesn't feel heavy on the feet. The ride is on the firmer side, but still has a little bounce. Not nearly as soft as the SG, but I more than the Sense Ride 4. 

It is extremely stable and has excellent protection.

This shoe left me with no blisters and all my toenails after my midsummer race tallying 55+ miles and 17K feet of elevation gain. 

I've put ~400 miles into the them and they're still going strong. I anticipate easily getting 600 miles out of them, probably a little more.

While you could certainly find a lighter shoe, this will do a great job if you're looking for a stable, durable, and protective shoe with excellent traction.

For sizing - use European sizing for reference. I stuck with Euro 43 which was spot on. If I would've gone with US 9.5, I would've been disappointed.
review.name: Great Long Distance Mountain Shoe

name: Akasha II Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The best shoe that can be found in size 14 & 4E. I only wish they’d offer some of the fancier colors that all the normal sized people get to choose from.
review.name: Ghost 16

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband as a gift , we both highly recommend brooks they’re a great shoe even if you’re not a runner, they last for yrs , you’ll definitely get you’re money bk in the yrs they last.
review.name: Very nice shoe

review.reviewBody: Fit well and felt fast, but nobody with wide feet gets the cool colors.
Great fit, but I wish 4x and other 2x shoes would come in more colors.
review.name: 4x ghosts

review.reviewBody: I use this shoes for walking mostly. Very comfortable and stable shoes.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable and they come in the extra wide width. need more shoes than a 4E in the Brooks ghost!!!
I'm a big Ghost fan, probably at least my tenth pair.  The sizing and fit has changed, it's smaller and squeezes my toes.
review.name: Ghost Fit and Sizing has changed

review.reviewBody: Upgraded from the Ghost 13, slightly wider through the foot which suits me perfect. Springy and cushioning at the same time, a joy to run and walk in.
review.name: So good I bought two pairs!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, add bounce to my run - been great for treadmill running so far as I’m not ready to get them dirty!
review.name: Bright and bouncy

review.reviewBody: I recently started running and am currently training for a half marathon. I've already had a pair of Under Armour Charged Pursuits and these were a HUGE step up. These shoes feel much softer and way more responsive. Though I have to admit the tox box is a bit wide. Otherwise these are amazing!
review.name: Woah

review.reviewBody:
I hated these at first and was about to return them. For the first several rides, these were digging into my feet causing me so much pain. I also had i play around with the tightness and cleat placement a lot to find the sweet spot.

They eventually broke in and I really started to enjoy them for all of the reasons I was hoping I would. Boa let's you dial in the fit, stuff, clipped in yet planted, ergonomics and great pedaling.
review.name: Give it some time

review.reviewBody: I have been using Specialized mt. and road bike shoes for 15 years.  Had two pairs of the previous 2FO Cliplite and the Rime 2.0 and loved each pair.  These new 2FO's are no good.  First, I have used 43.5's on all previous pairs, when I got that size my toes were slammed against the front.  Sent those back and ordered the 44.0.  They felt great at first sitting down but as soon as I stood up and walked around I had a lot of pain on top and inside of my ankle where the top of the tongue is.  Even when the top boa is loosened it still pinches.  I went to the Specialized website and the reviews there stated the same problem.  I think the top boa is built too far up the foot.  Super bummed as they look great and Specialized shoes always fit and worked well in the past.  If you order these make sure to tighten them up and walk around a lot before mounting them up.
review.name: Disappointing product from Specialized

name: 2FO ClipLite Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: The house end that attaches to the bladder is all I really needed , as I had a mishap with my original one. Would have just bought that if it was available for purchase.
review.name: Works for me

review.reviewBody: Product worked great, and delivery from time of order was speedy. I was going on an extended trip and just wanted to update my older drink tube which still works just fine. I wanted to take a newer one just to be sure. (Couldn't figure out what the purpose of the black thingy that came on the tube was so I never used that).
review.name: Platypus Drink Tube

review.reviewBody: Works well with my Platypus collapsible water bottles and fits in my Rouge Panda frame bag on my Salsa Fargo.
review.name: Turns a Collapsible Water Bottle into a Hydration System

review.reviewBody: Easy to use and I can even use it on none Camel back style bottles.
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: Fits my platypus gravity works clean water bag great and now I have a camelback! Very happy.
review.name: Fits my platypus gravity works

review.reviewBody: I wanted a simply hydration system that won't leak. Am trying this one, as I already had a platypus flex bottle. This needs a shutoff valve, I had one from an old camelback so I cut the tube and I put it on the tube. I also can't imagine not having a bite valve cover to keep it out of the mud when you lay your pack down, so I got one to go with this. It would be nice if this product came ready made with both. So far, it seems to be working fine now
review.name: Needs a few things

review.reviewBody: It fit as a perfect replacement tube on my older platypus. Very pleased.
review.name: Perfect replacement part

review.reviewBody: Stellar customer service helped determine that this was the correct replacement tube for my hydration bladder. I destroyed my previous tubing through neglect and it is super nice to have a shiny new (clean) setup.
review.name: Identical replacement part

review.reviewBody: The drink tube kit ONLY works with the Platy bottle.
review.name: Not satisfied

review.reviewBody: I used this extra tube to attach my katadyn water filtration pump directly to my platypus 3L bladder during my fall elk hunt. It was an excellent addition to my water kit. I never had to remove my bladder from my pack. Just unscrewed the tube running through my pack, screwed this one on and attached the other end (minus the drinking tip) to my pump and started filling.
review.name: I would recommend this product

name: Drink Tube Kit

description: Buy the NiteRider CherryBomb 100 Tail Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CherryBomb 100 Tail Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider CherryBomb 100 Tail Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had a battery operated one for 6 years and never a problem! Went to the ESB port rechargeable and had to replace after one year. Did this twice. Learned my lesson and now back to battery operated and live it! It's perfectly obnoxious for anyone behind me. A sure attention getter. That's why I own one. Looking forward to it being everlasting
review.name: NiteRider Cherrybomb

review.reviewBody:
Over eight to ten years for two bikes, I purchased three or four NiteRider headlights and at least as many NiteRider taillights& based primarily on the tech specs. Early ones were not rechargeable, later ones rechargeable.

Now questioning, er... abandoning, my brand loyalty.

One taillight simply stopped working (Cherry Bomb), another had the clip mount crack off, and the most recent one never lived up to the charging specs out of the box and quickly got worse from there (Solas). 

I'm a pride-of-ownership kinda person, take care of my stuff, have been anything but "hard" on these lights, and they've been unsatisfactory.

Without getting into the details, let's just say my interaction with NiteRider customer support was less than satisfying. Zero, zip, nada appreciation for my loyalty.

The OLED headlight still works fine after two seasons. But I'd steer as far away as I could from their taillights. Longevity sucks.

I'm likely to opt for the Specialized Stix Elite 2 Taillight or the Lyzene Strip Drive Pro Tail Light to replace the latest NiteRider that broke.
review.name: Steer Clear of NiteRider Taillights

review.reviewBody: I should have read the description before buying, but this does not have a rechargeable battery - it uses two AAA batteries.
review.name: not rechargeable

name: CherryBomb 100 Tail Light
