review.reviewBody: It keeps me warm and also looks professional to wear to work.
review.name: I love this product!

review.reviewBody: The arms ride up like a suit jacket. Poor quality check through the process but charging a premium price....this is never a good combo.
review.name: The fit has changed.

review.reviewBody: Several years ago I bought the earlier version of this jacket for that reason I bought this jacket for expecting the same great features and quality. I was sadly mistaken this is a horrible jacket and is nothing like its earlier version. I will be returning this jacket as soon as possible
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son. He has one from about 15 years ago. I thought it was time For a new one even though it is still in great shape. Unfortunately I purchased the wrong Size and had to return. He needs an extra tall large. Apparently NF does not carry tall sizes.
review.name: This is a great medium weight jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my second shell jacket of this type from the North Face. I like the fact that this jacket is a bit longer than the previous jack that I owned. It has a more modern look to it. It is great in wet weather and does a great job of keeping moisture away from my clothing. I wish that the jacket had cinches on the ends of the sleeves to make the fit tight around the wrists. I also would have preferred an embroidered North Face logo instead of the imprinted logo.
review.name: Love the Jacket with a couple caveats.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son. He absolutely loved it, but unfortunately it was too small.
review.name: I would buy again, but he needs an extra large tall!!

review.reviewBody: Best soft shell ever. Keeps me warm around 20 degrees Fahrenheit. Breathable as well. Waterproof as well. All around the best multipurpose jacket I've used
review.name: Amazing jacket

review.reviewBody: I love this coat. It's the 3rd one I've purchased since I'm now buying it for my family. Lightweight yet very warm.
review.name: Great coat for Fall and winter

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Fits as described. Great purchase. Would recommend to others
review.name: Perfect for fall

review.reviewBody: We use these as our department jackets and everyone loves them!
review.name: Great Jacket

hasVariant.name: Fuel Container 1 Gal
hasVariant.description: Buy the RotoPaX Fuel Container 1 Gal online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought as listed for fuel.Showed up water carrier.I know it will work for fuel I plan to add fuel stickers.
review.name: Not for fuel.But it will work

review.reviewBody: Bought two of these fuel containers and am unable to use because of the spouts.  Gas will not pour out of either container.  Am I missing something?
review.name: Can’t get gas to pour from spout

review.reviewBody: Sturdy can compact. convenience of storage options arte incredible
review.name: compact and sturdy

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my XR650L and kept wondering if it was going to be too big and bulky. It's not, its actually pretty small for what it is and the beating it takes. It does not leak at all and it comes with the filler tube inside of it. Motosport sells them the cheapest so if you need the extra gas you won't be disappointed with this little compact can, I've got 2 of them stacked on each other.
review.name: Great for the trails and great quality

review.reviewBody: Great product and easy to use. A little too expensive but happy its made in the USA. Extremely fast shipping.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: I bought the one gal can to carry extra fuel in my backpack for long rides. Works great for that only complaint is the spout it comes with. I don’t know if it was defective or not but we could not get it to work. I am going to order a normal spout not the cali compliant one it came with. Otherwise nice can for sure.
review.name: Nice gas can

review.reviewBody: Bought two 1.75 gallon cans to use on an Alaska moto trip and was not disappointed.  Had one can come part way off and rub on a tire while riding.  If this had happened to any other can, it would have burned through.  The Rotopax is stout and the filler tube and seal are rock solid.  They work very well.
review.name: Great insurance.

review.reviewBody: Very well made, Easy to use and i just ordered another one.
review.name: Many tie down points

review.reviewBody: Great concept - easy to mount and works perfectly.
review.name: Awesome product!

review.reviewBody: Very nice shallow profile fits my 2005 scrambler 500 4x4. However the nozzle needs to be covered with tarp and rubber band. Because going through mud and stuff, it will splash all over on top. So when ready to refuel, turn the nozzle inside out then try to tip and pour in gas tank without accidentally drop any dirt or mud in the tank.
review.name: Rotopax Gasoline Pack

name: Fuel Container 1 Gal

review.reviewBody: Love this Hemet!!! Beautiful and comfortable!! Exceptional safety features.

review.reviewBody: The fit was exactly as expected, I really like the features like fuzzy ear muffs and multiple vents that open and close. The design is comfortable and stylish. I also bought my husband the men’s version which he is very happy with.

review.reviewBody: I have a hard to fit small head. This helmet has various ways to adjust and I end up with a great fit! My Smith Google’s fit perfectly with it. Love these products!

review.reviewBody: This boot is my new favorite. After a decade in Burton Ions, I have found the new holy grail. Built with a similar approach (silhouette and materials) to the Ion but with a slightly more forgiving flex, LACES, a boa for extra heel hold and a Vibram outsole. Nidecker has definitely stepped up to the plate and knocked one out of the park… supportive, responsive, agile, comfortable and… laces! If you like a medium stiff boot and traditional laces… this boot is definitely worth checking out!!!
review.name: The New Benchmark

review.reviewBody: Purchased this helmet at a fantastic sale price. I chose it due to the very high safety ratings. It is certainly not the most comfortable helmet I've ever owned but I am primarily a roadie and used to wearing a helmet all day on the bike that feels like it was custom made for my head. The straps are also a bit thick and stiff. Hopefully, they will soften up over time. If it was a little more comfortable, I would certainly give this helmet 5 stars.
review.name: Could be More Comfortable
best protection rating... (currently)

review.reviewBody: @competitivecyclist your sizing guide for this helmet is wrong. For the large you have the Tactic 3 helmet sizing which is 63cm. This is the Tactic 4 and the large only goes to 62cm as is posted on the specialized site.
review.name: Sizing beware

description: Buy the Black Diamond Gold Label Adhesive online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gold Label Adhesive
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Gold Label Adhesive online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Don't buy new skins when yours stop working. You want to bring your old skins back to life? This adhesive will make that dream happen.
review.name: Re gluing skins

review.reviewBody: Last February, after 10 or so years. the glue on my Ascension skins seemed to be sticking to everything but the ski bases. With only a few weeks left in my season I went looking for cheap replacements . While in Wilson Backcountry Sports the proprietor suggested reglueing. I was skeptical to say the least. However another customer said that she had reglued her skins successfully. After reglueing and letting it cure, I can say that my skins stick to the ski bases 'as good as new' and worked flawlessly for the next 4 weeks. Highly recommend. With the caviet that the process is critical to the finish. Do the heat and scrape method to remove the majority of the old glue, then iron and brown paper bag to get the residual off. When applying, spread as evenly as possible then use an iron and parchment paper to smooth and even out. Watch some YouTube videos. Do this outside if at all possible. I had to do this in a garage due to outside temps being below freezing and required frequent breaks for fresh air. The fumes are deadly. 1 tube was just enough for my application. 168 x 92 sized skis. Got new skis this year and I came onto this site to purchase new skins, decided to leave a review as I am very impressed with this product being available if you need to reglue your skins instead of needing to buy new ones.
review.name: Worked great

review.reviewBody: This is the premium choice for regluing your skins. Does great tail touch ups or redo the entire length once it's torched.
review.name: The only glue you want

review.reviewBody: A great product. Very sticky. This will have your skins working like new with one simple application.
review.name: Adhesive

review.reviewBody: This is the stuff you need to replace adhesive on otherwise good condition skins
review.name: The Right Stuff

review.reviewBody: My skins were transferring glue to my skis. I removed the old glue and applied Gold Label, now they are good as new.
review.name: Tried and true

review.reviewBody:
Skins are expensive, and the glue often deteriorates, but the skins are still good.
expensive, and the glue often deteriorates, but the skins are still good. This glue is very easy to apply and restores your skins.
 The hard and messy part is removing the old blue.
review.name: Glue for skins

review.reviewBody: The gold standard for skin glue. They've dialed in the tackiness. Sicks well to skis, but still able to rip without removing ski wax. Pulling skins apart works well too, even in colder temps.
review.name: The Gold Standard

review.reviewBody: the glue works. doing the work to reglue a skin is like pulling your nails out of a frostbitten toe as it turns black and begins to cease its existence.
review.name: Its tacky and renews your skins

review.reviewBody: My old skins gave up the glue so my options were get new skins or try this re-glue thing. Followed the simple directions and I am surprised and impressed with the results. This glue works well, doesn't come off on the ski, does pickup pine needles and debris like all other skins but not horribly. It's not too hard to rip the skin either, so on the whole I am very pleased.
review.name: The Gold Standard

name: Gold Label Adhesive

review.reviewBody: I used this on my cross country skis that have permanent skins. I never used a product like this before and there isn't much of an explanation on how to apply. The first time I waxed at home and all was good, the 2nd time I was out skiing and the skins got very wet, I usually apply liquid wax and go on my way but this wax wouldn't stick, so I ended up building a fire to dry out skins then apply and all was good.
review.name: Not sure

review.reviewBody: I've had Platypus products for years and have the 2L version already. This one has fallen apart. First the slide stopped sealing the bag after about 5 months and leaked everywhere. So now I have to seal it by hand before putting the slide on. Then about 2 months ago the handle on the slide broke on the one side so I have to gingerly pull it out of my bag each time. Not worth the money.
review.name: quality is gone

review.reviewBody: Used on last couple long hikes in the Utah Capitol Reef Park. Works as expected. No leaks. Quality product.
review.name: Great water bladder

review.reviewBody: Great bladder. Easy to clean. Doesn't taste like plastic.
review.name: Great bladder. Easy to clean.

review.reviewBody: Old big ZIP was better easier to clean. New bags are terrible. Who ever designed this should be fired.
review.name: Old Big Zip was better

review.reviewBody: I like the pouch filling it was a little hard and I wish it had the magnetic clip for your bag instead of the plastic one
review.name: It's okay

review.reviewBody: My reservoir was delivered two days before my backpacking trip and arrived with a small hole in it. This caused it to leak and resulted in the inability to use it during my backpacking trip. I was extremely disappointed in the fact that it arrived in this poor condition because I specifically bought this because it was supposed to be a good brand. I tried calling the number for the website and no one ever answered so I am very displeased and will not make another purchase from this company.
review.name: I am very displeased

review.reviewBody: Purchased a 3L and loved it…..until the bite valve came off and we found that the bite valve & shut off valve were filled with some sort of gel-like substance. Can’t even remotely clean it out. Searched for info on what it is, and can’t figure out what it is. SO disappointed.
review.name: Confused

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd one. Finished the AT with my first one in 2012. Still working but time for a clean bladder. Backpacked with it this summer and still love it as much as I did on the AT!
review.name: Big Zip 3 liter Bladder

review.reviewBody:
No plastic water taste, great flow and awesome improvement on the bite valve BUT water stays in the fixed hose on the back after you’re done using it and it’s a pain to get the water out so it doesn’t get too funky.

The old version had the hose valve at the bottom which never allowed water to sit unless you left the hose on. I wish you guys made the old version with the new bite valve, that would be the magic recipe.
review.name: Some great features but one major design flaw

review.reviewBody: Flow is great, ease of filling is awesome, like the water tube attachment and fits well in my pack.
review.name: Great design and durability

name: Big Zip EVO Reservoir

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always carry it in my pocket so that I can drink water at any time. A very convenient mug. When my friends saw mine, they wanted the same one. You can quickly brew porridge or tea there, it folds up very simply and fits in any pocket
review.name: Frontier Ultralight Collapsible Cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this little cup!! 😍 It's cute and easy to store. It being collapsible is it's best feature. I can take it anywhere, such as to work or pack it to go camping or on a trip. When I take it to work, I just collapse it and slip it into a small compartment in my purse. It's lightweight and durable too! It's even dishwasher safe! It's also super easy for my small kids to drink from and I don't ever have to worry about it being broken. It's very hard to damage. I want more of these in all sizes and I will be purchasing some in the near future! 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Super Durable and Easy to Store! 😀

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my first time trying and using a collapsible cup for travel. It’s perfect. It is lightweight, convenient and easy to store. I love how I folds down or collapses allowing it to not take up much room. It’s easy to clean and just the right size meaning it doesn’t take up much room. It is also very sturdy. It is perfect and I definitely recommend it.
review.name: Perfect Collapsible Cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The set is extremely light and practical. I use this with Jetboil stoves and works perfectly.. so light and occupies so little space in the backpack. The engineering behind this is impressive.
review.name: The set is extremely light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This feels really high quality, I was quite surprised. It’s folds up so small. I’ve been using it to put outside for when the neighbors cat comes to visit. It holds up so well.
review.name: So cute and study!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Folds up easily, holds 1 cup and even has measuring lines on the inside. You can toss it in the dishwasher and it also has a solid base and drinking rim. Perfect little addition for your hike, camp, or even daily household use.
review.name: Perfect little cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I mainly use it for water for my puppy and myself when were out and about and I forget our drink cups perfect hold amount very durable and easy storage
review.name: Perfect on the go cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this collapsible cup! I can take it anywhere since it takes up so little space and I can fold it up and store it anywhere. It’s great to have on the go when you just need a drink.
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This cup is nice!! Love that it is collapsible so it’s easy to pack in a lunch box or take on the go - a super nice thing for kiddos! Easy to clean, love that it’s dishwasher friendly!
review.name: So nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These collapsible silicone cups are so convenient to carry. It's not just for camping outdoors, but it can be used even to local picnics or to the park. It's easy to clean and folds in neatly so i can carry it pretty much anywhere.
review.name: Frontier collapses in to a travel cup

name: Frontier UL Collapsible Cup

description: Buy the Crank Brothers Candy 7 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Candy 7 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Candy 7 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Been rocking these on the gravel bike for the past few months and love em. I've ridden Look, Shimano, and Time 2 bolt pedals, and none offer the same ease of clipping in/out with this amount of float.

The Candy has a bit of a body to provide stability on the steep technical doubletrack descents I love to ride here in Southern Colorado, just with the slight weight penalty compared to their well-known superlight mud-shedding hero younger brother, the Eggbeater.

They're easy to pull apart and service, spin super freely, and offer float adjustability by moving the right and left cleats between shoes. Get you a pair and enjoy the gravel/XC goodness.

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: One of the Best For A Reason

review.reviewBody: I?ve been on crank brothers pedals for a long time. Many years and miles. Mountain and gravel bike. My knees feel better due to their float. The 15 degree float is more than enough to mask anything but perfect alignment while installing the cleat to you shoes. The Candy 7 is the ?Goldielocks? of the range. You get the better bearings but still a steel spindle. A  lighter spindle material sacrifices durability for weight savings. Really, any pedal in this range is going to be great. Reading some other reviews here and I?ve experienced all the negative ones with any pedal. It?s a consumable item on a bike much like a chain or cassette.
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.reviewBody: So happy I moved to Crank Brothers from Shimano XT pedals! Never moving back! Shimano XT personally felt too difficult to clip in and work on.
review.name: Happy I moved to Crank Brothers!

name: Candy 7 Pedals

review.name: Not bleeding edge. Otherwise great
